book.description: A woman who has barely been beyond her English village finds herself while caring for a wealthy, embittered quadriplegic.
book.title: ME BEFORE YOU
book.author: Jojo Moyes

book.description: When a brutal murder threatens the domestic happiness of the San Francisco police detective Lindsay Boxer, she turns for help to the Women’s Murder Club.
book.title: 15TH AFFAIR
book.author: James Patterson and Maxine Paetro
book.contributor: by James Patterson and Maxine Paetro

book.description: On the North Carolina island of Belle Isle, a woman investigates her husband’s shady financial affairs after his mysterious death.
book.title: THE WEEKENDERS
book.author: Mary Kay Andrews

book.description: In a sequel to “Memory Man,” Amos Decker, a detective with an extraordinary memory, investigates the case of a convicted killer who wins a last-minute reprieve.
book.title: THE LAST MILE
book.author: David Baldacci

book.description: During an epidemic that causes people to spontaneously combust, an infected New Hampshire nurse fights to stay alive, aided by a mysterious figure known as the Fireman.
book.title: THE FIREMAN
book.author: Joe Hill

book.description: In a sequel to “The Ice Limit” (2000), Gideon Crew pursues a meteorite that has sunk to the ocean floor. Or is it only a meteorite?
book.title: BEYOND THE ICE LIMIT
book.author: Douglas Preston and Lincoln Child
book.contributor: by Douglas Preston and Lincoln Child

book.description: A psychological thriller set in the environs of London is full of complications and betrayals.
book.title: THE GIRL ON THE TRAIN
book.author: Paula Hawkins

book.description: Lucas Davenport, who has left the Minnesota Bureau of Criminal Apprehension, is in Iowa trying to foil a plot to assassinate a Hillary Clinton-like candidate. The 26th Lucas Davenport thriller.
book.title: EXTREME PREY
book.author: John Sandford

book.description: A nemesis is arrested, but his extensive network threatens revenge in the ninth book in the Rose Gardner mystery series.
book.title: THIRTY-SIX AND A HALF MOTIVES
book.author: Denise Grover Swank

book.description: When a widow on Nantucket learns she may lose her house, she turns it into a bed-and-breakfast. Originally published in 2008.
book.title: THE BEACH HOUSE
book.author: Jane Green

book.description: Wyoming’s Sheriff Walt Longmire (the inspiration for the Netflix series “Longmire”) encounters the supernatural in this novella.
book.title: THE HIGHWAYMAN
book.author: Craig Johnson

book.description: Siblings in a dysfunctional New York family must grapple with a reduced inheritance.
book.title: THE NEST
book.author: Cynthia D'Aprix Sweeney

book.description: After the death of Will Traynor, Louisa Clark joins a grief support group that may lead her to new love.
book.title: AFTER YOU
book.author: Jojo Moyes

book.description: Two sisters are separated in World War II France: one in the countryside, the other in Paris.
book.title: THE NIGHTINGALE
book.author: Kristin Hannah

book.description: Four young women share a Hell’s Kitchen loft.
book.title: THE APARTMENT
book.author: Danielle Steel

book.description: A curmudgeon's gruff exterior masks a generosity of spirit. Originally published in Sweden in 2014.
book.title: A MAN CALLED OVE
book.author: Fredrik Backman

book.description: A woman is haunted by her father’s crimes as she tries to pursue love and her work as a photographer.
book.title: THE OBSESSION
book.author: Nora Roberts

book.description: A deal with a fellow inmate, a crime boss, springs Nick Mason from prison, but he must become an assassin.
book.title: THE SECOND LIFE OF NICK MASON
book.author: Steve Hamilton
